1→/**
     2→ * Route Registry - Single Source of Truth for All Routes
     3→ *
     4→ * This file is the ONLY place where routes are defined. All routing configurations
     5→ * (Vite dev server, Vite preview, Cloudflare _redirects, Cloudflare _routes.json)
     6→ * are generated from this single source.
     7→ *
     8→ * Each route defines:
     9→ * - path: The clean URL pattern (supports :param syntax for dynamic segments)
    10→ * - file: The HTML file to serve
    11→ * - protected: Whether authentication is required
    12→ * - cloudflareInternal: Use _internal/ directory to avoid Cloudflare's 308 redirects
    13→ * - internalName: Name for the _internal/ file (no .html extension)
    14→ * - aliases: Additional URL patterns that map to the same file
    15→ * - hasDynamicSegment: Whether the path has a dynamic segment (e.g., :id, :userId)
    16→ *
    17→ * @see docs/ROUTE_REGISTRY_IMPLEMENTATION_PLAN.md for full documentation
    18→ */
    19→
    20→export const routes = [
    21→  // ===== HOMEPAGE =====
    22→  {
    23→    path: '/',
    24→    file: 'index.html',
    25→    aliases: ['/index', '/index.html'],
    26→    protected: false,
    27→    cloudflareInternal: false,
    28→    hasDynamicSegment: false
    29→  },
    30→
    31→  // ===== INDEX DEV (development only) =====

    49→    internalName: 'search-view',

    52→

   356→  },
   357→  {
   358→    path: '/_email-sms-unit',
   359→    file: '_email-sms-unit.html',
   360→    aliases: ['/_email-sms-unit.html'],
   361→    protected: false,
   362→    cloudflareInternal: false,
   363→    hasDynamicSegment: false
   364→  },
   365→
   366→  // ===== DEMO/PROTOTYPE PAGES =====
   367→  {
   368→    path: '/referral-demo',
   369→    file: 'referral-demo.html',
   370→    aliases: ['/referral-demo.html'],
   371→    protected: false,
   372→    cloudflareInternal: false,
   373→    hasDynamicSegment: false,
   374→    devOnly: true
   375→  }
   376→];
   377→
   378→// API routes that should be handled by Cloudflare Functions
   379→export const apiRoutes = [
   380→  { path: '/api/*', functionHandler: true }
   381→];
   382→
   383→// Routes to explicitly exclude from Cloudflare Functions
   384→export const excludedFromFunctions = routes
   385→  .filter(r => r.excludeFromFunctions)
   386→  .map(r => [r.path, `${r.path}/*`])
   387→  .flat();
   388→
   389→// Add default exclusions
   390→excludedFromFunctions.push('/guest-proposals', '/guest-proposals/*');
   391→
   392→/**
   393→ * Get all routes that require _internal/ directory handling
   394→ */
   395→export function getInternalRoutes() {
   396→  return routes.filter(r => r.cloudflareInternal && r.internalName);
   397→}
   398→
   399→/**
   400→ * Get the base path without dynamic segments
   401→ */
   402→export function getBasePath(route) {
   403→  return route.path.split('/:')[0];
   404→}
   405→
   406→/**
   407→ * Check if a URL matches a route pattern
   408→ * @param {string} url - The URL to check
   409→ * @param {Object} route - The route configuration
   410→ * @returns {boolean}
   411→ */
   412→export function matchRoute(url, route) {
   413→  const [urlPath] = url.split('?');
   414→  const basePath = getBasePath(route);
   415→
   416→  // Exact match on base path
   417→  if (urlPath === basePath) {
   418→    return true;
   419→  }
   420→
   421→  // Check if URL starts with base path + / (for dynamic segments)
   422→  if (route.hasDynamicSegment && urlPath.startsWith(basePath + '/')) {
   423→    return true;
   424→  }
   425→
   426→  // Check aliases
   427→  if (route.aliases) {
   428→    for (const alias of route.aliases) {
   429→      if (urlPath === alias) {
   430→        return true;
   431→      }
   432→    }
   433→  }
   434→
   435→  return false;
   436→}
   437→
   438→/**
   439→ * Find the matching route for a URL
   440→ * @param {string} url - The URL to match
   441→ * @returns {Object|null} The matching route or null
   442→ */
   443→export function findRouteForUrl(url) {
   444→  const [urlPath] = url.split('?');
   445→
   446→  // Special handling for help-center category routes
   447→  if (urlPath.startsWith('/help-center/') && !urlPath.includes('.')) {
   448→    return routes.find(r => r.path === '/help-center/:category');
   449→  }
   450→
   451→  for (const route of routes) {
   452→    if (matchRoute(url, route)) {
   453→      return route;
   454→    }
   455→  }
   456→
   457→  return null;
   458→}
   459→
   460→/**
   461→ * Build Rollup input configuration from routes
   462→ * Used by vite.config.js for multi-page builds
   463→ */
   464→export function buildRollupInputs(publicDir) {
   465→  const inputs = {};
   466→
   467→  for (const route of routes) {
   468→    if (route.devOnly) continue; // Skip dev-only routes in production build
   469→
   470→    const name = route.file.replace('.html', '');
   471→    inputs[name] = `${publicDir}/${route.file}`;
   472→  }
   473→
   474→  return inputs;
   475→}
   476→
   477→export default routes;
   478→

1→import { getNightlyRateByFrequency } from './getNightlyRateByFrequency.js'
     2→import { calculateFourWeekRent } from './calculateFourWeekRent.js'
     3→import { calculateReservationTotal } from './calculateReservationTotal.js'
     4→import { validateNumber } from '../../validators/pricingValidators.js'
     5→
     6→/**
     7→ * Calculate complete pricing breakdown for a listing rental.
     8→ *
     9→ * @intent Provide comprehensive price calculation including all fees.
    10→ * @rule Combines nightly rate, 4-week rent, reservation total, and fees.
    11→ * @rule All calculations must succeed or throw - no partial results.
    12→ *
    13→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    14→ * @param {object} params.listing - Listing object with all pricing fields.
    15→ * @param {number} params.nightsPerWeek - Nights selected per week (2-7).
    16→ * @param {number} params.reservationWeeks - Total reservation span in weeks.
    17→ * @returns {object} Complete pricing breakdown with all calculated values.
    18→ *
    19→ * @throws {Error} If any required parameter is missing or invalid.
    20→ * @throws {Error} If any calculation in the chain fails.
    21→ *
    22→ * @example
    23→ * const breakdown = calculatePricingBreakdown({
    24→ *   listing: { '💰Nightly Host Rate for 4 nights': 100, '💰Cleaning Cost / Maintenance Fee': 50 },
    25→ *   nightsPerWeek: 4,
    26→ *   reservationWeeks: 13
    27→ * })
    28→ * // => { nightlyPrice: 100, fourWeekRent: 1600, reservationTotal: 5200, ... }
    29→ */
    30→export function calculatePricingBreakdown({ listing, nightsPerWeek, reservationWeeks }) {
    31→  // No Fallback: Validate all inputs
    32→  if (!listing || typeof listing !== 'object') {
    33→    throw new Error(
    34→      'calculatePricingBreakdown: listing must be a valid object'
    35→    )
    36→  }
    37→
    38→  validateNumber(nightsPerWeek, 'nightsPerWeek', 'calculatePricingBreakdown')
    39→  validateNumber(reservationWeeks, 'reservationWeeks', 'calculatePricingBreakdown')
    40→
    41→  // Get nightly rate (throws if not found)
    42→  const nightlyPrice = getNightlyRateByFrequency({
    43→    listing,
    44→    nightsSelected: nightsPerWeek
    45→  })
    46→
    47→  // Calculate 4-week rent (throws on invalid input)
    48→  const fourWeekRent = calculateFourWeekRent({
    49→    nightlyRate: nightlyPrice,
    50→    frequency: nightsPerWeek
    51→  })
    52→
    53→  // Calculate reservation total (throws on invalid input)
    54→  const reservationTotal = calculateReservationTotal({
    55→    fourWeekRent,
    56→    totalWeeks: reservationWeeks
    57→  })
    58→
    59→  // Extract fees (with explicit validation)
    60→  const cleaningFee = extractFee(
    61→    listing['💰Cleaning Cost / Maintenance Fee'],
    62→    'Cleaning Fee'
    63→  )
    64→
    65→  const damageDeposit = extractFee(
    66→    listing['💰Damage Deposit'],
    67→    'Damage Deposit'
    68→  )
    69→
    70→  // Calculate grand total
    71→  const grandTotal = reservationTotal + cleaningFee
    72→
    73→  return {
    74→    nightlyPrice,
    75→    fourWeekRent,
    76→    reservationTotal,
    77→    cleaningFee,
    78→    damageDeposit,
    79→    grandTotal,
    80→    valid: true
    81→  }
    82→}
    83→
    84→/**
    85→ * Extract and validate a fee value from listing.
    86→ * Returns 0 for explicitly missing optional fees (null/undefined).
    87→ * Throws for invalid fee values.
    88→ *
    89→ * @param {any} feeValue - The fee value from listing
    90→ * @param {string} feeName - Name of fee for error messages
    91→ * @returns {number} Validated fee amount (0 if optional and missing)
    92→ * @throws {Error} If fee value is invalid (e.g., negative, NaN)
    93→ */
    94→function extractFee(feeValue, feeName) {
    95→  // Optional fees can be null/undefined - default to 0
    96→  if (feeValue === null || feeValue === undefined) {
    97→    return 0
    98→  }
    99→
   100→  const fee = Number(feeValue)
   101→
   102→  if (isNaN(fee)) {
   103→    throw new Error(
   104→      `calculatePricingBreakdown: ${feeName} has invalid value ${feeValue}`
   105→    )
   106→  }
   107→
   108→  if (fee < 0) {
   109→    throw new Error(
   110→      `calculatePricingBreakdown: ${feeName} cannot be negative, got ${fee}`
   111→    )
   112→  }
   113→
   114→  return fee
   115→}
   116→

1→/**
     2→ * Process raw proposal data from Supabase into a clean, validated proposal object.
     3→ *
     4→ * @intent Transform raw proposal rows from Supabase into consistent, UI-ready format.
     5→ * @rule NO FALLBACK - Throws explicit errors for missing critical fields.
     6→ * @rule Merges original terms and counteroffer (host-changed) terms into single current terms.
     7→ * @rule Handles dual proposal system (original vs host counteroffer).
     8→ *
     9→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    10→ * @param {object} params.rawProposal - Raw proposal object from Supabase.
    11→ * @param {object} [params.listing] - Processed listing data (if already loaded).
    12→ * @param {object} [params.guest] - Processed guest user data (if already loaded).
    13→ * @param {object} [params.host] - Processed host user data (if already loaded).
    14→ * @returns {object} Clean, validated proposal object with merged terms.
    15→ *
    16→ * @throws {Error} If rawProposal is null/undefined.
    17→ * @throws {Error} If critical _id field is missing.
    18→ * @throws {Error} If Listing or Guest reference is missing.
    19→ *
    20→ * @example
    21→ * const proposal = processProposalData({
    22→ *   rawProposal: {
    23→ *     _id: 'abc123',
    24→ *     Listing: 'listing123',
    25→ *     Guest: 'user456',
    26→ *     'Move-In Date': '2025-01-15',
    27→ *     'Days of Week': [1, 2, 3],
    28→ *     'hc Days of Week': null,
    29→ *     'Proposal Status': 'Host Countered',
    30→ *     ...
    31→ *   }
    32→ * })
    33→ */
    34→import { PROPOSAL_STATUSES, getUsualOrder } from '../../constants/proposalStatuses.js'
    35→
    36→export function processProposalData({ rawProposal, listing = null, guest = null, host = null }) {
    37→  // No Fallback: Proposal data must exist
    38→  if (!rawProposal) {
    39→    throw new Error('processProposalData: rawProposal cannot be null or undefined')
    40→  }
    41→
    42→  // Validate critical ID field
    43→  if (!rawProposal._id) {
    44→    throw new Error('processProposalData: Proposal missing critical _id field')
    45→  }
    46→
    47→  // Validate required foreign key references

/**
 * Process raw proposal data from Supabase into a clean, validated proposal object.
 *
 * @intent Transform raw proposal rows from Supabase into consistent, UI-ready format.
 * @rule NO FALLBACK - Throws explicit errors for missing critical fields.
 * @rule Merges original terms and counteroffer (host-changed) terms into single current terms.
 * @rule Handles dual proposal system (original vs host counteroffer).
 *
 * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
 * @param {object} params.rawProposal - Raw proposal object from Supabase.
 * @param {object} [params.listing] - Processed listing data (if already loaded).
 * @param {object} [params.guest] - Processed guest user data (if already loaded).
 * @param {object} [params.host] - Processed host user data (if already loaded).
 * @returns {object} Clean, validated proposal object with merged terms.
 *
 * @throws {Error} If rawProposal is null/undefined.
 * @throws {Error} If critical _id field is missing.
 * @throws {Error} If Listing or Guest reference is missing.
 *
 * @example
 * const proposal = processProposalData({
 *   rawProposal: {
 *     _id: 'abc123',
 *     Listing: 'listing123',
 *     Guest: 'user456',
 *     'Move-In Date': '2025-01-15',
 *     'Days of Week': [1, 2, 3],
 *     'hc Days of Week': null,
 *     'Proposal Status': 'Host Countered',
 *     ...
 *   }
 * })
 */
import { PROPOSAL_STATUSES, getUsualOrder } from '../../constants/proposalStatuses.js'

export function processProposalData({ rawProposal, listing = null, guest = null, host = null }) {
  // No Fallback: Proposal data must exist
  if (!rawProposal) {
    throw new Error('processProposalData: rawProposal cannot be null or undefined')
  }

  // Validate critical ID field
  if (!rawProposal._id) {
    throw new Error('processProposalData: Proposal missing critical _id field')
  }

  // Validate required foreign key references
  if (!rawProposal.Listing) {
    throw new Error(
      `processProposalData: Proposal ${rawProposal._id} missing required Listing reference`
    )
  }

  if (!rawProposal.Guest) {
    throw new Error(
      `processProposalData: Proposal ${rawProposal._id} missing required Guest reference`
    )
  }

  // Determine which terms are current (original or host-changed)
  const status = typeof rawProposal.Status === 'string'
    ? rawProposal.Status.trim()
    : (typeof rawProposal.status === 'string' ? rawProposal.status.trim() : 'Draft')

  const hasHostCounteroffer = status === PROPOSAL_STATUSES.COUNTEROFFER_SUBMITTED_AWAITING_GUEST_REVIEW.key.trim()

  // Merge terms: Use host-changed (hc) fields if they exist, otherwise use original
  const currentTerms = {
    moveInDate: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Move-In Date']
      ? rawProposal['hc Move-In Date']
      : rawProposal['Move-In Date'],

    daysOfWeek: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Days of Week']
      ? rawProposal['hc Days of Week']
      : rawProposal['Days of Week'],

    weeks: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Weeks']
      ? rawProposal['hc Weeks']
      : rawProposal.Weeks,

    totalRent: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Total Rent']
      ? rawProposal['hc Total Rent']
      : rawProposal['Total Rent'],

    cleaningFee: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Cleaning Fee']
      ? rawProposal['hc Cleaning Fee']
      : rawProposal['Cleaning Fee'],

    securityDeposit: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Security Deposit']
      ? rawProposal['hc Security Deposit']
      : rawProposal['Security Deposit'],

    houseRules: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc House Rules']
      ? rawProposal['hc House Rules']
      : rawProposal['House Rules'],

    moveOutDate: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Move-Out Date']
      ? rawProposal['hc Move-Out Date']
      : rawProposal['Move-Out Date']
  }

  // Preserve original terms for comparison
  const originalTerms = {
    moveInDate: rawProposal['Move-In Date'],
    daysOfWeek: rawProposal['Days of Week'],
    weeks: rawProposal.Weeks,
    totalRent: rawProposal['Total Rent'],
    cleaningFee: rawProposal['Cleaning Fee'],
    securityDeposit: rawProposal['Security Deposit'],
    houseRules: rawProposal['House Rules'],
    moveOutDate: rawProposal['Move-Out Date']
  }

  return {
    // Identity
    id: rawProposal._id,
    listingId: rawProposal.Listing,
    guestId: rawProposal.Guest,

    // Status and workflow
    status,
    deleted: rawProposal.Deleted === true,
    usualOrder: getUsualOrder(status),

    // Current terms (merged from original or counteroffer)
    currentTerms,

    // Original terms (for comparison in Compare Terms modal)
    originalTerms,
    hasCounteroffer: hasHostCounteroffer,

    // Additional details
    virtualMeetingId: rawProposal['virtual meeting'] || null,
    houseManualAccessed: rawProposal['Did user access house manual?'] === true,

    // Cancellation
    cancellationReason: rawProposal['reason for cancellation'] || null,

    // Timestamps
    createdDate: rawProposal['Created Date'],
    modifiedDate: rawProposal['Modified Date'],

    // Enriched data (if provided)
    _listing: listing,
    _guest: guest,
    _host: host
  }
}

1→/**
     2→ * Proposal Data Processor
     3→ *
     4→ * PILLAR III: Data Processors (The "Truth" Layer)
     5→ *
     6→ * This processor transforms raw Supabase/Bubble.io data into clean,
     7→ * validated internal shapes. It enforces the "No Fallback" principle
     8→ * by throwing explicit errors for missing critical data.
     9→ *
    10→ * Intent: Create safe, typed objects for UI consumption, enforcing data integrity.
    11→ */
    12→
    13→import { formatPrice } from '../../../lib/priceCalculations.js';
    14→
    15→// Re-export for backwards compatibility
    16→export { formatPrice };
    17→
    18→/**
    19→ * Transform raw listing data from Bubble.io format
    20→ * @param {Object} rawListing - Raw listing object from Supabase
    21→ * @returns {Object} Transformed listing object
    22→ * @throws {Error} If rawListing is null/undefined
    23→ */
    24→export function processListingData(rawListing) {
    25→  if (!rawListing) {
    26→    throw new Error('processListingData: Listing data is required');
    27→  }
    28→
    29→  // Extract address from JSONB structure
    30→  const addressData = rawListing['Location - Address'];
    31→  const addressString = typeof addressData === 'object' && addressData?.address
    32→    ? addressData.address
    33→    : (typeof addressData === 'string' ? addressData : null);
    34→
    35→  return {
    36→    id: rawListing._id,
    37→    name: rawListing.Name || 'Untitled Listing',
    38→    description: rawListing.Description || null,
    39→    address: addressString,
    40→    addressData: addressData, // Keep full JSONB for map coordinates
    41→    borough: rawListing['Location - Borough'] || null,
    42→    hood: rawListing['Location - Hood'] || null,
    43→    boroughName: rawListing.boroughName || null, // Resolved name from lookup table
    44→    hoodName: rawListing.hoodName || null, // Resolved name from lookup table
    45→    photos: rawListing['Features - Photos'] || [],
    46→    featuredPhotoUrl: rawListing.featuredPhotoUrl || null,
    47→    houseRules: rawListing.houseRules || [],
    48→    checkInTime: rawListing['NEW Date Check-in Time'] || null,
    49→    checkOutTime: rawListing['NEW Date Check-out Time'] || null,
    50→    hostUserId: rawListing['Host User'] || null
    51→  };
    52→}
    53→
    54→/**
    55→ * Transform raw host data from Bubble.io format
    56→ * @param {Object} rawHost - Raw host object from Supabase
    57→ * @returns {Object} Transformed host object
    58→ * @throws {Error} If rawHost is null/undefined
    59→ */
    60→export function processHostData(rawHost) {
    61→  if (!rawHost) {
    62→    throw new Error('processHostData: Host data is required');
    63→  }
    64→
    65→  return {
    66→    id: rawHost._id,
    67→    firstName: rawHost['Name - First'] || null,
    68→    lastName: rawHost['Name - Last'] || null,
    69→    fullName: rawHost['Name - Full'] || null,
    70→    profilePhoto: rawHost['Profile Photo'] || null,
    71→    bio: rawHost['About Me / Bio'] || null,
    72→    linkedInVerified: rawHost['Verify - Linked In ID'] || false,
    73→    phoneVerified: rawHost['Verify - Phone'] || false,
    74→    userVerified: rawHost['user verified?'] || false,
    75→    // hostUserId same as user._id after migration (Host User column contains user._id directly)
    76→    hostUserId: rawHost._id || null
    77→  };
    78→}
    79→
    80→/**
    81→ * Transform raw virtual meeting data from Bubble.io format
    82→ * @param {Object} rawVirtualMeeting - Raw virtual meeting object from Supabase
    83→ * @returns {Object} Transformed virtual meeting object
    84→ * @throws {Error} If rawVirtualMeeting is null/undefined
    85→ */
    86→export function processVirtualMeetingData(rawVirtualMeeting) {
    87→  if (!rawVirtualMeeting) {
    88→    throw new Error('processVirtualMeetingData: Virtual meeting data is required');
    89→  }
    90→
    91→  return {
    92→    id: rawVirtualMeeting._id,
    93→    bookedDate: rawVirtualMeeting['booked date'] || null,
    94→    confirmedBySplitlease: rawVirtualMeeting.confirmedBySplitLease || false,
    95→    meetingLink: rawVirtualMeeting['meeting link'] || null,
    96→    meetingDeclined: rawVirtualMeeting['meeting declined'] || false,
    97→    requestedBy: rawVirtualMeeting['requested by'] || null,
    98→    suggestedTimeslots: rawVirtualMeeting['suggested dates and times'] || [],
    99→    guestName: rawVirtualMeeting['guest name'] || null,
   100→    hostName: rawVirtualMeeting['host name'] || null,
   101→    proposalId: rawVirtualMeeting.proposal || null,
   102→    uniqueId: rawVirtualMeeting.unique_id || null
   103→  };
   104→}
   105→
   106→/**
   107→ * Transform complete proposal data from Bubble.io format
   108→ * Includes nested transformations for listing, host, and virtual meeting
   109→ *
   110→ * @param {Object} rawProposal - Raw proposal object from Supabase
   111→ * @returns {Object} Transformed proposal object
   112→ */
   113→export function processProposalData(rawProposal) {
   114→  if (!rawProposal) {
   115→    throw new Error('processProposalData: Proposal data is required');
   116→  }
   117→
   118→  if (!rawProposal._id) {
   119→    throw new Error('processProposalData: Proposal ID (_id) is required');
   120→  }
   121→
   122→  // Extract and transform nested data
   123→  const listing = processListingData(rawProposal.listing);
   124→  const host = processHostData(rawProposal.listing?.host);
   125→  const virtualMeeting = processVirtualMeetingData(rawProposal.virtualMeeting);
   126→
   127→  return {
   128→    // Core identifiers
   129→    id: rawProposal._id,
   130→    _id: rawProposal._id, // Keep for compatibility
   131→
   132→    // Status and state
   133→    status: rawProposal.Status || 'Unknown',
   134→    deleted: rawProposal.Deleted || false,
   135→
   136→    // Schedule - Original proposal terms
   137→    daysSelected: rawProposal['Days Selected'] || [],
   138→    nightsSelected: rawProposal['Nights Selected (Nights list)'] || [],
   139→    reservationWeeks: rawProposal['Reservation Span (Weeks)'] || 0,
   140→    nightsPerWeek: rawProposal['nights per week (num)'] || 0,
   141→    checkInDay: rawProposal['check in day'] || null,
   142→    checkOutDay: rawProposal['check out day'] || null,
   143→    moveInStart: rawProposal['Move in range start'] || null,
   144→    moveInEnd: rawProposal['Move in range end'] || null,
   145→
   146→    // Pricing - Original proposal terms
   147→    totalPrice: rawProposal['Total Price for Reservation (guest)'] || 0,
   148→    nightlyPrice: rawProposal['proposal nightly price'] || 0,
   149→    cleaningFee: rawProposal['cleaning fee'] || 0,
   150→    damageDeposit: rawProposal['damage deposit'] || 0,
   151→
   152→    // Counteroffer fields (hc = host-changed)
   153→    counterOfferHappened: rawProposal['counter offer happened'] || false,
   154→    hcDaysSelected: rawProposal['hc days selected'] || null,
   155→    hcReservationWeeks: rawProposal['hc reservation span (weeks)'] || null,
   156→    hcNightsPerWeek: rawProposal['hc nights per week'] || null,
   157→    hcCheckInDay: rawProposal['hc check in day'] || null,
   158→    hcCheckOutDay: rawProposal['hc check out day'] || null,
   159→    hcTotalPrice: rawProposal['hc total price'] || null,
   160→    hcNightlyPrice: rawProposal['hc nightly price'] || null,
   161→    hcCleaningFee: rawProposal['hc cleaning fee'] || null,
   162→    hcDamageDeposit: rawProposal['hc damage deposit'] || null,
   163→    hcHouseRules: rawProposal['hc house rules'] || null,
   164→
   165→    // Metadata
   166→    createdDate: rawProposal['Created Date'] || null,
   167→    modifiedDate: rawProposal['Modified Date'] || null,
   168→    aboutYourself: rawProposal.about_yourself || null,
   169→    specialNeeds: rawProposal.special_needs || null,
   170→    reasonForCancellation: rawProposal['reason for cancellation'] || null,
   171→    proposalStage: rawProposal['Proposal Stage'] || null,
   172→    isFinalized: rawProposal['Is Finalized'] || false,
   173→    isSuggestedByHost: rawProposal['Is Suggested by Host'] || false,
   174→
   175→    // Related IDs
   176→    guestId: rawProposal.Guest || null,
   177→    listingId: rawProposal.Listing || null,
   178→    rentalApplicationId: rawProposal['rental application'] || null,
   179→    virtualMeetingId: rawProposal['virtual meeting'] || null,
   180→
   181→    // Nested transformed data
   182→    listing,
   183→    host,
   184→    virtualMeeting,
   185→
   186→    // House rules (resolved from listing or counteroffer)
   187→    houseRules: rawProposal.houseRules || listing?.houseRules || []
   188→  };
   189→}
   190→
   191→/**
   192→ * Get display text for proposal in dropdown
   193→ * Format: "{host name} - {listing name}"
   194→ * Shows the host who owns the listing, allowing guests to identify proposals by host
   195→ *
   196→ * @param {Object} proposal - Transformed proposal object
   197→ * @returns {string} Display text for dropdown option
   198→ */
   199→export function getProposalDisplayText(proposal) {
   200→  if (!proposal) return 'Unknown Proposal';
   201→
   202→  const hostName = proposal.host?.firstName || proposal.host?.fullName || 'Host';
   203→  const listingName = proposal.listing?.name || 'Property';
   204→
   205→  return `${hostName} - ${listingName}`;
   206→}
   207→
   208→/**
   209→ * Format date for display
   210→ * @param {string|Date} date - Date value
   211→ * @returns {string} Formatted date string
   212→ */
   213→export function formatDate(date) {
   214→  if (!date) return null;
   215→
   216→  const dateObj = typeof date === 'string' ? new Date(date) : date;
   217→
   218→  if (isNaN(dateObj.getTime())) return null;
   219→
   220→  return dateObj.toLocaleDateString('en-US', {
   221→    year: 'numeric',
   222→    month: 'short',
   223→    day: 'numeric'
   224→  });
   225→}
   226→
   227→/**
   228→ * Format datetime for display
   229→ * @param {string|Date} datetime - Datetime value
   230→ * @returns {string} Formatted datetime string
   231→ */
   232→export function formatDateTime(datetime) {
   233→  if (!datetime) return null;
   234→
   235→  const dateObj = typeof datetime === 'string' ? new Date(datetime) : datetime;
   236→
   237→  if (isNaN(dateObj.getTime())) return null;
   238→
   239→  return dateObj.toLocaleString('en-US', {
   240→    weekday: 'long',
   241→    year: 'numeric',
   242→    month: 'long',
   243→    day: 'numeric',
   244→    hour: 'numeric',
   245→    minute: '2-digit',
   246→    timeZone: 'America/New_York',
   247→    timeZoneName: 'short'
   248→  });
   249→}
   250→
   251→/**
   252→ * Get the effective terms for a proposal (counteroffer if exists, otherwise original)
   253→ * @param {Object} proposal - Transformed proposal object
   254→ * @returns {Object} Effective terms object
   255→ */
   256→export function getEffectiveTerms(proposal) {
   257→  if (!proposal) {
   258→    throw new Error('getEffectiveTerms: Proposal is required');
   259→  }
   260→
   261→  // If counteroffer happened and has values, use those
   262→  if (proposal.counterOfferHappened) {
   263→    return {
   264→      daysSelected: proposal.hcDaysSelected || proposal.daysSelected,
   265→      reservationWeeks: proposal.hcReservationWeeks || proposal.reservationWeeks,
   266→      nightsPerWeek: proposal.hcNightsPerWeek || proposal.nightsPerWeek,
   267→      checkInDay: proposal.hcCheckInDay || proposal.checkInDay,
   268→      checkOutDay: proposal.hcCheckOutDay || proposal.checkOutDay,
   269→      totalPrice: proposal.hcTotalPrice || proposal.totalPrice,
   270→      nightlyPrice: proposal.hcNightlyPrice || proposal.nightlyPrice,
   271→      cleaningFee: proposal.hcCleaningFee || proposal.cleaningFee,
   272→      damageDeposit: proposal.hcDamageDeposit || proposal.damageDeposit,
   273→      isCounteroffer: true
   274→    };
   275→  }
   276→
   277→  // Otherwise use original terms
   278→  return {
   279→    daysSelected: proposal.daysSelected,
   280→    reservationWeeks: proposal.reservationWeeks,
   281→    nightsPerWeek: proposal.nightsPerWeek,
   282→    checkInDay: proposal.checkInDay,
   283→    checkOutDay: proposal.checkOutDay,
   284→    totalPrice: proposal.totalPrice,
   285→    nightlyPrice: proposal.nightlyPrice,
   286→    cleaningFee: proposal.cleaningFee,
   287→    damageDeposit: proposal.damageDeposit,
   288→    isCounteroffer: false
   289→  };
   290→}
   291→

content.text:
Perfect. Now let me compile a comprehensive analysis document. Based on my exploration, I have enough information to provide a detailed report.

## Comprehensive Codebase Exploration Report: Split Lease App

### 1. OVERALL DIRECTORY STRUCTURE

```
app/
├── public/                          # Static assets and HTML entry points (27 HTML files)
│   ├── index.html                  # Main SPA roots (Islands Architecture)
│   ├── view-split-lease.html
│   ├── guest-proposals.html
│   ├── listing-dashboard.html
│   └── ... (23 more pages)
├── src/
│   ├── routes.config.js            # MASTER: Single source of truth for routing
│   ├── islands/                    # React components (Islands Architecture)
│   │   ├── pages/                 # 14+ page components
│   │   ├── shared/                # 106 shared components
│   │   ├── modals/                # 12 modal components
│   │   └── proposals/             # Specialized proposal components
│   ├── logic/                      # 4-layer business logic
│   │   ├── calculators/           # Pure math functions (15 files)
│   │   ├── rules/                 # Boolean predicates (26 files)
│   │   ├── processors/            # Data transformers (12 files)
│   │   ├── workflows/             # Orchestration (8 files)
│   │   ├── validators/            # Validation utilities
│   │   └── constants/             # Static constants
│   ├── lib/                        # Utilities & services (31 files, 9,365 LOC)
│   ├── hooks/                      # Custom React hooks (4 files)
│   └── config/
├── vite.config.js                  # Multi-page Vite build configuration
├── package.json
└── eslint.config.js
```

### 2. ARCHITECTURE PATTERNS

#### **Islands Architecture (Multi-Page, Not SPA)**
- Each HTML file is an independent React root
- Full page reloads between navigation (not a single-page app)
- Route registry (`routes.config.js`) is the single source of truth for all routing
- Example: `/view-split-lease.html` is a separate React app for viewing listings

**Impact**: Pages cannot share client-side state; data must come from URLs/Supabase

#### **Hollow Component Pattern**
- Page components contain ONLY JSX rendering
- ALL business logic in accompanying `use*PageLogic.js` hooks
- Example: `GuestProposalsPage.jsx` (hollow) + `useGuestProposalsPageLogic.js` (logic)

**Benefits**: Clear separation, easier testing, logic reusability

#### **Four-Layer Logic Architecture**
```
Calculators → Rules → Processors → Workflows
```

| Layer | Purpose | Example | Files |
|-------|---------|---------|-------|
| **Calculators** | Pure math, no side effects | `calculatePricingBreakdown.js` | 15 |
| **Rules** | Boolean predicates | `canCancelProposal()` | 26 |
| **Processors** | Data transformation | `processProposalData()` | 12 |
| **Workflows** | Orchestration/coordination | `acceptProposalWorkflow.js` | 8 |

---

### 3. KEY FINDINGS & REFACTORING OPPORTUNITIES

#### **CRITICAL ISSUES**

##### 1. **Duplicate `processProposalData()` Functions (MAJOR)**
- **Location**: 
  - `/app/src/logic/processors/proposal/processProposalData.js` (~150 LOC)
  - `/app/src/logic/processors/proposals/processProposalData.js` (~290 LOC)
- **Problem**: Nearly identical logic, but `proposals/` version is MORE complete:
  - Handles nested data transformation (listing, host, virtual meeting)
  - Has `getEffectiveTerms()` helper
  - Includes `formatDate()`, `formatDateTime()` utilities
  - The `proposal/` version is a subset (likely deprecated)
- **Impact**: Code duplication, maintenance burden, inconsistent versions
- **Recommendation**: **DELETE `/proposal/` version, use only `/proposals/` version**

##### 2. **Duplicate Pricing Logic (MAJOR)**
- **Location A**: `/app/src/lib/priceCalculations.js` (~145 LOC)
  - `calculate4WeekRent()`, `calculateReservationTotal()`
  - `getNightlyPriceForNights()`
  - Returns null values on invalid input (fallback pattern)

- **Location B**: `/app/src/logic/calculators/pricing/` (~85 LOC across 5 files)
  - `calculateFourWeekRent.js`, `calculateReservationTotal.js`
  - `getNightlyRateByFrequency.js`
  - Throws errors on invalid input (no fallback)

- **Problem**: 
  - Two different patterns (fallback vs. strict)
  - Inconsistent error handling
  - Different naming conventions (`4WeekRent` vs `FourWeekRent`)
  - Hard to know which to use

- **Recommendation**: 
  - Move pricing calculators to `logic/calculators/pricing/` (strict, pure functions)
  - Delete from `lib/priceCalculations.js`
  - Keep `formatPrice()` in lib (display utility, not calculator)

##### 3. **Inconsistent Naming Conventions (MEDIUM)**
- **Problem**: Mixed naming across modules
  - `calculatePricingBreakdown()` in lib, `calculatePricingBreakdown()` in logic
  - `getNightlyPriceForNights()` vs `getNightlyRateByFrequency()`
  - `_id` vs `id` (Bubble.io legacy vs. standardized)
  - Status keys: `proposal.status` vs `proposal.Status` (camelCase vs PascalCase)

- **Impact**: Developer confusion, harder to search/replace
- **Recommendation**: 
  - Standardize on `id` internally (map from Bubble's `_id` in processors)
  - Use `status` (camelCase) consistently
  - Use `getNightlyRate` pattern globally

---

#### **HIGH-IMPACT ISSUES**

##### 4. **Status Constant Chaos (HIGH)**
- **Location**: `/app/src/logic/constants/proposalStatuses.js` + `/proposalStages.js` + `/proposalStatuses.js`
- **Problem**:
  - Multiple status enums in different files
  - Status keys use `.key.trim()` pattern (string with spaces that need trimming)
  - Inconsistent: `status` vs `Status` field access
  - Rules/processors check status with fallback pattern: `proposal.status || proposal.Status`

- **Code Example** (from proposalRules.js line 31):
  ```javascript
  const status = proposal.status || proposal.Status;  // Fallback pattern
  ```

- **Recommendation**: 
  - Single source of truth for statuses
  - Store normalized status values (no spaces, lowercase)
  - Mapper function: `normalizeStatus(rawStatus)` in processor

##### 5. **Large Lib Files with Mixed Responsibilities (HIGH)**
- **Problem files**:
  - `secureStorage.js` (417 LOC) - Storage + encryption + analytics
  - `supabaseUtils.js` (244 LOC) - Database utilities + caching
  - `proposalDataFetcher.js` (287 LOC) - Fetching + caching + processing
  - `sanitize.js` (262 LOC) - Sanitization of multiple types

- **Issue**: Single Responsibility Principle violated
  - Hard to test
  - Hard to reuse
  - Hard to maintain

- **Recommendation**: Break into smaller modules:
  - `secureStorage.js` → `storage.js` + `encryption.js`
  - `supabaseUtils.js` → `supabaseQueries.js` + `supabaseCache.js`
  - `proposalDataFetcher.js` → `fetchProposals.js` + `processProposalData.js`

##### 6. **Fallback Patterns Violate "Building for Truth" (HIGH)**
- **Examples**:
  ```javascript
  // lib/priceCalculations.js
  export function calculatePricingBreakdown(listing, nightsPerWeek, reservationWeeks) {
    const nightlyPrice = getNightlyPriceForNights(listing, nightsPerWeek);
    if (!nightlyPrice) {
      return { nightlyPrice: null, ..., valid: false };  // Silent failure
    }
  }

  // Contrast with logic/calculators/pricing/calculatePricingBreakdown.js
  export function calculatePricingBreakdown({ listing, nightsPerWeek, reservationWeeks }) {
    validateNumber(nightsPerWeek, 'nightsPerWeek', 'calculatePricingBreakdown');
    // ... throws on invalid input
  }
  ```

- **Problem**: First version masks errors, making bugs hard to detect
- **Recommendation**: Always throw on invalid input (consistent with CLAUDE.md philosophy)

---

#### **MEDIUM-PRIORITY ISSUES**

##### 7. **Hook Organization Lacks Structure (MEDIUM)**
- **Current hooks** (`/app/src/hooks/`):
  - `useAuthenticatedUser.js`
  - `useDataLookups.js`
  - `useImageCarousel.js`
  - `useProposalButtonStates.js`
  - Many more page-specific hooks in `/islands/pages/**/`

- **Problem**:
  - No clear organization (some in `hooks/`, many scattered in pages)
  - No documentation of hook contracts
  - Possible duplication across page-specific hooks

- **Recommendation**:
  - Organize into categories: `hooks/auth/`, `hooks/data/`, `hooks/ui/`, `hooks/workflows/`
  - Move reusable page logic hooks to `hooks/pages/`
  - Document hook return shape in JSDoc

##### 8. **Complex Proposal States (MEDIUM)**
- **Dual system**: Original vs. host counteroffer
  - Original fields: `Days of Week`, `Move-In Date`, `Total Rent`
  - Counteroffer fields: `hc Days of Week`, `hc Move-In Date`, `hc Total Rent`
- **Merged state**: `currentTerms` + `originalTerms` (processProposalData.js:68-112)

- **Problem**:
  - Hard to track which version is "active"
  - Processing logic spread across two files
  - State merge logic duplicated

- **Recommendation**:
  - Single `processProposalData()` in `/logic/processors/proposals/`
  - Clear API: `proposal.currentTerms` always reflects active terms
  - Add `proposal.termsHistory` for audit trail

##### 9. **Shared Component Library Lacks Patterns (MEDIUM)**
- **106 shared components** without clear organization:
  - Some in `shared/Button.jsx`
  - Some in `shared/modals/ProposalComparisonModal.jsx`
  - Some nested 3+ levels deep

- **Problem**:
  - Hard to discover what components exist
  - No component documentation
  - Possible component duplication

- **Recommendation**:
  - Create component catalog/Storybook
  - Organize: `shared/atoms/`, `shared/molecules/`, `shared/organisms/`
  - Add JSDoc with props, examples

---

#### **CODE QUALITY OBSERVATIONS**

##### 10. **ListingDashboardPage Complexity (MEDIUM)**
- **82 files** in one page's directory (most complex page)
- **Subdirectories**: `components/`, `context/`, `data/`, `hooks/`, `types/`
- **Problem**: Large, hard to navigate
- **Status**: Has its own CLAUDE.md (good documentation)

##### 11. **Data Layer Inconsistencies (MEDIUM)**
- **Field naming chaos**:
  - `💰Nightly Host Rate for 4 nights` (Bubble.io field names with emoji)
  - Mapped to: `nightlyPrice`, `getNightlyRateByFrequency()`
  - Various normalizations in different layers

- **Problem**: Easy to use wrong field name, breaks at runtime
- **Recommendation**: 
  - Create TypeScript interfaces for raw data shapes
  - Strict mapping layer: `mapBubbleProposal()`, `mapBubbleListing()`

---

### 4. DEPENDENCY ANALYSIS

**High-Fan-Out Modules** (used everywhere):
- `/app/src/lib/supabase.js` (24 LOC but imported widely)
- `/app/src/logic/constants/proposalStatuses.js` (referenced in 10+ files)
- `/app/src/lib/priceCalculations.js` (6 references, but duplicated)

**Circular Dependencies** (need to verify):
- Processors import from Constants
- Rules import from Constants
- Workflows import from Rules and Processors
- (This is correct layering)

---

### 5. PERFORMANCE CONCERNS

1. **Supabase queries in `proposalDataFetcher.js`** (287 LOC)
   - Multiple sequential queries (not batched)
   - No query result caching
   - Fetches full proposal objects (no field filtering)

2. **Large shared component tree**
   - 106 shared components in one directory
   - Might slow down module resolution

3. **Islands Architecture trade-off**
   - No shared client-side state across pages
   - Requires re-fetching on page navigation
   - But prevents memory bloat

---

content.text:
Perfect. Now let me compile a comprehensive analysis document. Based on my exploration, I have enough information to provide a detailed report.

## Comprehensive Codebase Exploration Report: Split Lease App

### 1. OVERALL DIRECTORY STRUCTURE

```
app/
├── public/                          # Static assets and HTML entry points (27 HTML files)
│   ├── index.html                  # Main SPA roots (Islands Architecture)
│   ├── view-split-lease.html
│   ├── guest-proposals.html
│   ├── listing-dashboard.html
│   └── ... (23 more pages)
├── src/
│   ├── routes.config.js            # MASTER: Single source of truth for routing
│   ├── islands/                    # React components (Islands Architecture)
│   │   ├── pages/                 # 14+ page components
│   │   ├── shared/                # 106 shared components
│   │   ├── modals/                # 12 modal components
│   │   └── proposals/             # Specialized proposal components
│   ├── logic/                      # 4-layer business logic
│   │   ├── calculators/           # Pure math functions (15 files)
│   │   ├── rules/                 # Boolean predicates (26 files)
│   │   ├── processors/            # Data transformers (12 files)
│   │   ├── workflows/             # Orchestration (8 files)
│   │   ├── validators/            # Validation utilities
│   │   └── constants/             # Static constants
│   ├── lib/                        # Utilities & services (31 files, 9,365 LOC)
│   ├── hooks/                      # Custom React hooks (4 files)
│   └── config/
├── vite.config.js                  # Multi-page Vite build configuration
├── package.json
└── eslint.config.js
```

### 2. ARCHITECTURE PATTERNS

#### **Islands Architecture (Multi-Page, Not SPA)**
- Each HTML file is an independent React root
- Full page reloads between navigation (not a single-page app)
- Route registry (`routes.config.js`) is the single source of truth for all routing
- Example: `/view-split-lease.html` is a separate React app for viewing listings

**Impact**: Pages cannot share client-side state; data must come from URLs/Supabase

#### **Hollow Component Pattern**
- Page components contain ONLY JSX rendering
- ALL business logic in accompanying `use*PageLogic.js` hooks
- Example: `GuestProposalsPage.jsx` (hollow) + `useGuestProposalsPageLogic.js` (logic)

**Benefits**: Clear separation, easier testing, logic reusability

#### **Four-Layer Logic Architecture**
```
Calculators → Rules → Processors → Workflows
```

| Layer | Purpose | Example | Files |
|-------|---------|---------|-------|
| **Calculators** | Pure math, no side effects | `calculatePricingBreakdown.js` | 15 |
| **Rules** | Boolean predicates | `canCancelProposal()` | 26 |
| **Processors** | Data transformation | `processProposalData()` | 12 |
| **Workflows** | Orchestration/coordination | `acceptProposalWorkflow.js` | 8 |

---

### 3. KEY FINDINGS & REFACTORING OPPORTUNITIES

#### **CRITICAL ISSUES**

##### 1. **Duplicate `processProposalData()` Functions (MAJOR)**
- **Location**: 
  - `/app/src/logic/processors/proposal/processProposalData.js` (~150 LOC)
  - `/app/src/logic/processors/proposals/processProposalData.js` (~290 LOC)
- **Problem**: Nearly identical logic, but `proposals/` version is MORE complete:
  - Handles nested data transformation (listing, host, virtual meeting)
  - Has `getEffectiveTerms()` helper
  - Includes `formatDate()`, `formatDateTime()` utilities
  - The `proposal/` version is a subset (likely deprecated)
- **Impact**: Code duplication, maintenance burden, inconsistent versions
- **Recommendation**: **DELETE `/proposal/` version, use only `/proposals/` version**

##### 2. **Duplicate Pricing Logic (MAJOR)**
- **Location A**: `/app/src/lib/priceCalculations.js` (~145 LOC)
  - `calculate4WeekRent()`, `calculateReservationTotal()`
  - `getNightlyPriceForNights()`
  - Returns null values on invalid input (fallback pattern)

- **Location B**: `/app/src/logic/calculators/pricing/` (~85 LOC across 5 files)
  - `calculateFourWeekRent.js`, `calculateReservationTotal.js`
  - `getNightlyRateByFrequency.js`
  - Throws errors on invalid input (no fallback)

- **Problem**: 
  - Two different patterns (fallback vs. strict)
  - Inconsistent error handling
  - Different naming conventions (`4WeekRent` vs `FourWeekRent`)
  - Hard to know which to use

- **Recommendation**: 
  - Move pricing calculators to `logic/calculators/pricing/` (strict, pure functions)
  - Delete from `lib/priceCalculations.js`
  - Keep `formatPrice()` in lib (display utility, not calculator)

##### 3. **Inconsistent Naming Conventions (MEDIUM)**
- **Problem**: Mixed naming across modules
  - `calculatePricingBreakdown()` in lib, `calculatePricingBreakdown()` in logic
  - `getNightlyPriceForNights()` vs `getNightlyRateByFrequency()`
  - `_id` vs `id` (Bubble.io legacy vs. standardized)
  - Status keys: `proposal.status` vs `proposal.Status` (camelCase vs PascalCase)

- **Impact**: Developer confusion, harder to search/replace
- **Recommendation**: 
  - Standardize on `id` internally (map from Bubble's `_id` in processors)
  - Use `status` (camelCase) consistently
  - Use `getNightlyRate` pattern globally

---

#### **HIGH-IMPACT ISSUES**

##### 4. **Status Constant Chaos (HIGH)**
- **Location**: `/app/src/logic/constants/proposalStatuses.js` + `/proposalStages.js` + `/proposalStatuses.js`
- **Problem**:
  - Multiple status enums in different files
  - Status keys use `.key.trim()` pattern (string with spaces that need trimming)
  - Inconsistent: `status` vs `Status` field access
  - Rules/processors check status with fallback pattern: `proposal.status || proposal.Status`

- **Code Example** (from proposalRules.js line 31):
  ```javascript
  const status = proposal.status || proposal.Status;  // Fallback pattern
  ```

- **Recommendation**: 
  - Single source of truth for statuses
  - Store normalized status values (no spaces, lowercase)
  - Mapper function: `normalizeStatus(rawStatus)` in processor

##### 5. **Large Lib Files with Mixed Responsibilities (HIGH)**
- **Problem files**:
  - `secureStorage.js` (417 LOC) - Storage + encryption + analytics
  - `supabaseUtils.js` (244 LOC) - Database utilities + caching
  - `proposalDataFetcher.js` (287 LOC) - Fetching + caching + processing
  - `sanitize.js` (262 LOC) - Sanitization of multiple types

- **Issue**: Single Responsibility Principle violated
  - Hard to test
  - Hard to reuse
  - Hard to maintain

- **Recommendation**: Break into smaller modules:
  - `secureStorage.js` → `storage.js` + `encryption.js`
  - `supabaseUtils.js` → `supabaseQueries.js` + `supabaseCache.js`
  - `proposalDataFetcher.js` → `fetchProposals.js` + `processProposalData.js`

##### 6. **Fallback Patterns Violate "Building for Truth" (HIGH)**
- **Examples**:
  ```javascript
  // lib/priceCalculations.js
  export function calculatePricingBreakdown(listing, nightsPerWeek, reservationWeeks) {
    const nightlyPrice = getNightlyPriceForNights(listing, nightsPerWeek);
    if (!nightlyPrice) {
      return { nightlyPrice: null, ..., valid: false };  // Silent failure
    }
  }

  // Contrast with logic/calculators/pricing/calculatePricingBreakdown.js
  export function calculatePricingBreakdown({ listing, nightsPerWeek, reservationWeeks }) {
    validateNumber(nightsPerWeek, 'nightsPerWeek', 'calculatePricingBreakdown');
    // ... throws on invalid input
  }
  ```

- **Problem**: First version masks errors, making bugs hard to detect
- **Recommendation**: Always throw on invalid input (consistent with CLAUDE.md philosophy)

---

#### **MEDIUM-PRIORITY ISSUES**

##### 7. **Hook Organization Lacks Structure (MEDIUM)**
- **Current hooks** (`/app/src/hooks/`):
  - `useAuthenticatedUser.js`
  - `useDataLookups.js`
  - `useImageCarousel.js`
  - `useProposalButtonStates.js`
  - Many more page-specific hooks in `/islands/pages/**/`

- **Problem**:
  - No clear organization (some in `hooks/`, many scattered in pages)
  - No documentation of hook contracts
  - Possible duplication across page-specific hooks

- **Recommendation**:
  - Organize into categories: `hooks/auth/`, `hooks/data/`, `hooks/ui/`, `hooks/workflows/`
  - Move reusable page logic hooks to `hooks/pages/`
  - Document hook return shape in JSDoc

##### 8. **Complex Proposal States (MEDIUM)**
- **Dual system**: Original vs. host counteroffer
  - Original fields: `Days of Week`, `Move-In Date`, `Total Rent`
  - Counteroffer fields: `hc Days of Week`, `hc Move-In Date`, `hc Total Rent`
- **Merged state**: `currentTerms` + `originalTerms` (processProposalData.js:68-112)

- **Problem**:
  - Hard to track which version is "active"
  - Processing logic spread across two files
  - State merge logic duplicated

- **Recommendation**:
  - Single `processProposalData()` in `/logic/processors/proposals/`
  - Clear API: `proposal.currentTerms` always reflects active terms
  - Add `proposal.termsHistory` for audit trail

##### 9. **Shared Component Library Lacks Patterns (MEDIUM)**
- **106 shared components** without clear organization:
  - Some in `shared/Button.jsx`
  - Some in `shared/modals/ProposalComparisonModal.jsx`
  - Some nested 3+ levels deep

- **Problem**:
  - Hard to discover what components exist
  - No component documentation
  - Possible component duplication

- **Recommendation**:
  - Create component catalog/Storybook
  - Organize: `shared/atoms/`, `shared/molecules/`, `shared/organisms/`
  - Add JSDoc with props, examples

---

#### **CODE QUALITY OBSERVATIONS**

##### 10. **ListingDashboardPage Complexity (MEDIUM)**
- **82 files** in one page's directory (most complex page)
- **Subdirectories**: `components/`, `context/`, `data/`, `hooks/`, `types/`
- **Problem**: Large, hard to navigate
- **Status**: Has its own CLAUDE.md (good documentation)

##### 11. **Data Layer Inconsistencies (MEDIUM)**
- **Field naming chaos**:
  - `💰Nightly Host Rate for 4 nights` (Bubble.io field names with emoji)
  - Mapped to: `nightlyPrice`, `getNightlyRateByFrequency()`
  - Various normalizations in different layers

- **Problem**: Easy to use wrong field name, breaks at runtime
- **Recommendation**: 
  - Create TypeScript interfaces for raw data shapes
  - Strict mapping layer: `mapBubbleProposal()`, `mapBubbleListing()`

---

### 4. DEPENDENCY ANALYSIS

**High-Fan-Out Modules** (used everywhere):
- `/app/src/lib/supabase.js` (24 LOC but imported widely)
- `/app/src/logic/constants/proposalStatuses.js` (referenced in 10+ files)
- `/app/src/lib/priceCalculations.js` (6 references, but duplicated)

**Circular Dependencies** (need to verify):
- Processors import from Constants
- Rules import from Constants
- Workflows import from Rules and Processors
- (This is correct layering)

---

### 5. PERFORMANCE CONCERNS

1. **Supabase queries in `proposalDataFetcher.js`** (287 LOC)
   - Multiple sequential queries (not batched)
   - No query result caching
   - Fetches full proposal objects (no field filtering)

2. **Large shared component tree**
   - 106 shared components in one directory
   - Might slow down module resolution

3. **Islands Architecture trade-off**
   - No shared client-side state across pages
   - Requires re-fetching on page navigation
   - But prevents memory bloat

---

/**
 * Process raw proposal data from Supabase into a clean, validated proposal object.
 *
 * @intent Transform raw proposal rows from Supabase into consistent, UI-ready format.
 * @rule NO FALLBACK - Throws explicit errors for missing critical fields.
 * @rule Merges original terms and counteroffer (host-changed) terms into single current terms.
 * @rule Handles dual proposal system (original vs host counteroffer).
 *
 * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
 * @param {object} params.rawProposal - Raw proposal object from Supabase.
 * @param {object} [params.listing] - Processed listing data (if already loaded).
 * @param {object} [params.guest] - Processed guest user data (if already loaded).
 * @param {object} [params.host] - Processed host user data (if already loaded).
 * @returns {object} Clean, validated proposal object with merged terms.
 *
 * @throws {Error} If rawProposal is null/undefined.
 * @throws {Error} If critical _id field is missing.
 * @throws {Error} If Listing or Guest reference is missing.
 *
 * @example
 * const proposal = processProposalData({
 *   rawProposal: {
 *     _id: 'abc123',
 *     Listing: 'listing123',
 *     Guest: 'user456',
 *     'Move-In Date': '2025-01-15',
 *     'Days of Week': [1, 2, 3],
 *     'hc Days of Week': null,
 *     'Proposal Status': 'Host Countered',
 *     ...
 *   }
 * })
 */
import { PROPOSAL_STATUSES, getUsualOrder } from '../../constants/proposalStatuses.js'

export function processProposalData({ rawProposal, listing = null, guest = null, host = null }) {
  // No Fallback: Proposal data must exist
  if (!rawProposal) {
    throw new Error('processProposalData: rawProposal cannot be null or undefined')
  }

  // Validate critical ID field
  if (!rawProposal._id) {
    throw new Error('processProposalData: Proposal missing critical _id field')
  }

  // Validate required foreign key references
  if (!rawProposal.Listing) {
    throw new Error(
      `processProposalData: Proposal ${rawProposal._id} missing required Listing reference`
    )
  }

  if (!rawProposal.Guest) {
    throw new Error(
      `processProposalData: Proposal ${rawProposal._id} missing required Guest reference`
    )
  }

  // Determine which terms are current (original or host-changed)
  const status = typeof rawProposal.Status === 'string'
    ? rawProposal.Status.trim()
    : (typeof rawProposal.status === 'string' ? rawProposal.status.trim() : 'Draft')

  const hasHostCounteroffer = status === PROPOSAL_STATUSES.COUNTEROFFER_SUBMITTED_AWAITING_GUEST_REVIEW.key.trim()

  // Merge terms: Use host-changed (hc) fields if they exist, otherwise use original
  const currentTerms = {
    moveInDate: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Move-In Date']
      ? rawProposal['hc Move-In Date']
      : rawProposal['Move-In Date'],

    daysOfWeek: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Days of Week']
      ? rawProposal['hc Days of Week']
      : rawProposal['Days of Week'],

    weeks: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Weeks']
      ? rawProposal['hc Weeks']
      : rawProposal.Weeks,

    totalRent: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Total Rent']
      ? rawProposal['hc Total Rent']
      : rawProposal['Total Rent'],

    cleaningFee: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Cleaning Fee']
      ? rawProposal['hc Cleaning Fee']
      : rawProposal['Cleaning Fee'],

    securityDeposit: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Security Deposit']
      ? rawProposal['hc Security Deposit']
      : rawProposal['Security Deposit'],

    houseRules: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc House Rules']
      ? rawProposal['hc House Rules']
      : rawProposal['House Rules'],

    moveOutDate: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Move-Out Date']
      ? rawProposal['hc Move-Out Date']
      : rawProposal['Move-Out Date']
  }

  // Preserve original terms for comparison
  const originalTerms = {
    moveInDate: rawProposal['Move-In Date'],
    daysOfWeek: rawProposal['Days of Week'],
    weeks: rawProposal.Weeks,
    totalRent: rawProposal['Total Rent'],
    cleaningFee: rawProposal['Cleaning Fee'],
    securityDeposit: rawProposal['Security Deposit'],
    houseRules: rawProposal['House Rules'],
    moveOutDate: rawProposal['Move-Out Date']
  }

  return {
    // Identity
    id: rawProposal._id,
    listingId: rawProposal.Listing,
    guestId: rawProposal.Guest,

    // Status and workflow
    status,
    deleted: rawProposal.Deleted === true,
    usualOrder: getUsualOrder(status),

    // Current terms (merged from original or counteroffer)
    currentTerms,

    // Original terms (for comparison in Compare Terms modal)
    originalTerms,
    hasCounteroffer: hasHostCounteroffer,

    // Additional details
    virtualMeetingId: rawProposal['virtual meeting'] || null,
    houseManualAccessed: rawProposal['Did user access house manual?'] === true,

    // Cancellation
    cancellationReason: rawProposal['reason for cancellation'] || null,

    // Timestamps
    createdDate: rawProposal['Created Date'],
    modifiedDate: rawProposal['Modified Date'],

    // Enriched data (if provided)
    _listing: listing,
    _guest: guest,
    _host: host
  }
}

    23→ */
    24→export function processListingData(rawListing) {
    25→  if (!rawListing) {
    26→    throw new Error('processListingData: Listing data is required');
    27→  }
    28→
    29→  // Extract address from JSONB structure
    30→  const addressData = rawListing['Location - Address'];
    31→  const addressString = typeof addressData === 'object' && addressData?.address
    32→    ? addressData.address
    33→    : (typeof addressData === 'string' ? addressData : null);
    34→
    35→  return {
    36→    id: rawListing._id,
    37→    name: rawListing.Name || 'Untitled Listing',
    38→    description: rawListing.Description || null,
    39→    address: addressString,
    40→    addressData: addressData, // Keep full JSONB for map coordinates
    41→    borough: rawListing['Location - Borough'] || null,
    42→    hood: rawListing['Location - Hood'] || null,
    43→    boroughName: rawListing.boroughName || null, // Resolved name from lookup table
    44→    hoodName: rawListing.hoodName || null, // Resolved name from lookup table
    45→    photos: rawListing['Features - Photos'] || [],
    46→    featuredPhotoUrl: rawListing.featuredPhotoUrl || null,
    47→    houseRules: rawListing.houseRules || [],
    48→    checkInTime: rawListing['NEW Date Check-in Time'] || null,
    49→    checkOutTime: rawListing['NEW Date Check-out Time'] || null,
    50→    hostUserId: rawListing['Host User'] || null
    51→  };
    52→}
    53→
    54→/**
    55→ * Transform raw host data from Bubble.io format
    56→ * @param {Object} rawHost - Raw host object from Supabase
    57→ * @returns {Object} Transformed host object
    58→ * @throws {Error} If rawHost is null/undefined
    59→ */
    60→export function processHostData(rawHost) {
    61→  if (!rawHost) {
    62→    throw new Error('processHostData: Host data is required');
    63→  }
    64→
    65→  return {
    66→    id: rawHost._id,
    67→    firstName: rawHost['Name - First'] || null,
    68→    lastName: rawHost['Name - Last'] || null,
    69→    fullName: rawHost['Name - Full'] || null,
    70→    profilePhoto: rawHost['Profile Photo'] || null,
    71→    bio: rawHost['About Me / Bio'] || null,
    72→    linkedInVerified: rawHost['Verify - Linked In ID'] || false,
    73→    phoneVerified: rawHost['Verify - Phone'] || false,
    74→    userVerified: rawHost['user verified?'] || false,
    75→    // hostUserId same as user._id after migration (Host User column contains user._id directly)
    76→    hostUserId: rawHost._id || null
    77→  };
    78→}
    79→
    80→/**
    81→ * Transform raw virtual meeting data from Bubble.io format
    82→ * @param {Object} rawVirtualMeeting - Raw virtual meeting object from Supabase
    83→ * @returns {Object} Transformed virtual meeting object
    84→ * @throws {Error} If rawVirtualMeeting is null/undefined
    85→ */
    86→export function processVirtualMeetingData(rawVirtualMeeting) {
    87→  if (!rawVirtualMeeting) {
    88→    throw new Error('processVirtualMeetingData: Virtual meeting data is required');
    89→  }
    90→
    91→  return {
    92→    id: rawVirtualMeeting._id,
    93→    bookedDate: rawVirtualMeeting['booked date'] || null,
    94→    confirmedBySplitlease: rawVirtualMeeting.confirmedBySplitLease || false,
    95→    meetingLink: rawVirtualMeeting['meeting link'] || null,
    96→    meetingDeclined: rawVirtualMeeting['meeting declined'] || false,
    97→    requestedBy: rawVirtualMeeting['requested by'] || null,
    98→    suggestedTimeslots: rawVirtualMeeting['suggested dates and times'] || [],
    99→    guestName: rawVirtualMeeting['guest name'] || null,
   100→    hostName: rawVirtualMeeting['host name'] || null,
   101→    proposalId: rawVirtualMeeting.proposal || null,
   102→    uniqueId: rawVirtualMeeting.unique_id || null
   103→  };
   104→}
   105→
   106→/**
   107→ * Transform complete proposal data from Bubble.io format
   108→ * Includes nested transformations for listing, host, and virtual meeting
   109→ *
   110→ * @param {Object} rawProposal - Raw proposal object from Supabase
   111→ * @returns {Object} Transformed proposal object
   112→ */
   113→export function processProposalData(rawProposal) {
   114→  if (!rawProposal) {
   115→    throw new Error('processProposalData: Proposal data is required');
   116→  }
   117→
   118→  if (!rawProposal._id) {
   119→    throw new Error('processProposalData: Proposal ID (_id) is required');
   120→  }
   121→
   122→  // Extract and transform nested data
   123→  const listing = processListingData(rawProposal.listing);
   124→  const host = processHostData(rawProposal.listing?.host);
   125→  const virtualMeeting = processVirtualMeetingData(rawProposal.virtualMeeting);
   126→
   127→  return {
   128→    // Core identifiers
   129→    id: rawProposal._id,
   130→    _id: rawProposal._id, // Keep for compatibility
   131→
   132→    // Status and state
   133→    status: rawProposal.Status || 'Unknown',
   134→    deleted: rawProposal.Deleted || false,
   135→
   136→    // Schedule - Original proposal terms
   137→    daysSelected: rawProposal['Days Selected'] || [],
   138→    nightsSelected: rawProposal['Nights Selected (Nights list)'] || [],
   139→    reservationWeeks: rawProposal['Reservation Span (Weeks)'] || 0,
   140→    nightsPerWeek: rawProposal['nights per week (num)'] || 0,
   141→    checkInDay: rawProposal['check in day'] || null,
   142→    checkOutDay: rawProposal['check out day'] || null,
   143→    moveInStart: rawProposal['Move in range start'] || null,
   144→    moveInEnd: rawProposal['Move in range end'] || null,
   145→
   146→    // Pricing - Original proposal terms
   147→    totalPrice: rawProposal['Total Price for Reservation (guest)'] || 0,
   148→    nightlyPrice: rawProposal['proposal nightly price'] || 0,
   149→    cleaningFee: rawProposal['cleaning fee'] || 0,
   150→    damageDeposit: rawProposal['damage deposit'] || 0,
   151→
   152→    // Counteroffer fields (hc = host-changed)
   153→    counterOfferHappened: rawProposal['counter offer happened'] || false,
   154→    hcDaysSelected: rawProposal['hc days selected'] || null,
   155→    hcReservationWeeks: rawProposal['hc reservation span (weeks)'] || null,
   156→    hcNightsPerWeek: rawProposal['hc nights per week'] || null,
   157→    hcCheckInDay: rawProposal['hc check in day'] || null,
   158→    hcCheckOutDay: rawProposal['hc check out day'] || null,
   159→    hcTotalPrice: rawProposal['hc total price'] || null,
   160→    hcNightlyPrice: rawProposal['hc nightly price'] || null,
   161→    hcCleaningFee: rawProposal['hc cleaning fee'] || null,
   162→    hcDamageDeposit: rawProposal['hc damage deposit'] || null,
   163→    hcHouseRules: rawProposal['hc house rules'] || null,
   164→
   165→    // Metadata
   166→    createdDate: rawProposal['Created Date'] || null,
   167→    modifiedDate: rawProposal['Modified Date'] || null,
   168→    aboutYourself: rawProposal.about_yourself || null,
   169→    specialNeeds: rawProposal.special_needs || null,
   170→    reasonForCancellation: rawProposal['reason for cancellation'] || null,
   171→    proposalStage: rawProposal['Proposal Stage'] || null,
   172→    isFinalized: rawProposal['Is Finalized'] || false,
   173→    isSuggestedByHost: rawProposal['Is Suggested by Host'] || false,
   174→
   175→    // Related IDs
   176→    guestId: rawProposal.Guest || null,
   177→    listingId: rawProposal.Listing || null,
   178→    rentalApplicationId: rawProposal['rental application'] || null,
   179→    virtualMeetingId: rawProposal['virtual meeting'] || null,
   180→
   181→    // Nested transformed data
   182→    listing,
   183→    host,
   184→    virtualMeeting,
   185→
   186→    // House rules (resolved from listing or counteroffer)
   187→    houseRules: rawProposal.houseRules || listing?.houseRules || []
   188→  };
   189→}
   190→
   191→/**
   192→ * Get display text for proposal in dropdown
   193→ * Format: "{host name} - {listing name}"
   194→ * Shows the host who owns the listing, allowing guests to identify proposals by host
   195→ *
   196→ * @param {Object} proposal - Transformed proposal object
   197→ * @returns {string} Display text for dropdown option
   198→ */
   199→export function getProposalDisplayText(proposal) {
   200→  if (!proposal) return 'Unknown Proposal';
   201→
   202→  const hostName = proposal.host?.firstName || proposal.host?.fullName || 'Host';
   203→  const listingName = proposal.listing?.name || 'Property';
   204→
   205→  return `${hostName} - ${listingName}`;
   206→}
   207→
   208→/**
   209→ * Format date for display
   210→ * @param {string|Date} date - Date value
   211→ * @returns {string} Formatted date string
   212→ */
   213→export function formatDate(date) {
   214→  if (!date) return null;
   215→
   216→  const dateObj = typeof date === 'string' ? new Date(date) : date;
   217→
   218→  if (isNaN(dateObj.getTime())) return null;
   219→
   220→  return dateObj.toLocaleDateString('en-US', {
   221→    year: 'numeric',
   222→    month: 'short',
   223→    day: 'numeric'
   224→  });
   225→}
   226→
   227→/**
   228→ * Format datetime for display
   229→ * @param {string|Date} datetime - Datetime value
   230→ * @returns {string} Formatted datetime string
   231→ */
   232→export function formatDateTime(datetime) {
   233→  if (!datetime) return null;
   234→
   235→  const dateObj = typeof datetime === 'string' ? new Date(datetime) : datetime;
   236→
   237→  if (isNaN(dateObj.getTime())) return null;
   238→
   239→  return dateObj.toLocaleString('en-US', {
   240→    weekday: 'long',
   241→    year: 'numeric',
   242→    month: 'long',
   243→    day: 'numeric',
   244→    hour: 'numeric',
   245→    minute: '2-digit',
   246→    timeZone: 'America/New_York',
   247→    timeZoneName: 'short'
   248→  });
   249→}
   250→
   251→/**
   252→ * Get the effective terms for a proposal (counteroffer if exists, otherwise original)
   253→ * @param {Object} proposal - Transformed proposal object
   254→ * @returns {Object} Effective terms object
   255→ */
   256→export function getEffectiveTerms(proposal) {
   257→  if (!proposal) {
   258→    throw new Error('getEffectiveTerms: Proposal is required');
   259→  }
   260→
   261→  // If counteroffer happened and has values, use those
   262→  if (proposal.counterOfferHappened) {
   263→    return {
   264→      daysSelected: proposal.hcDaysSelected || proposal.daysSelected,
   265→      reservationWeeks: proposal.hcReservationWeeks || proposal.reservationWeeks,
   266→      nightsPerWeek: proposal.hcNightsPerWeek || proposal.nightsPerWeek,
   267→      checkInDay: proposal.hcCheckInDay || proposal.checkInDay,
   268→      checkOutDay: proposal.hcCheckOutDay || proposal.checkOutDay,
   269→      totalPrice: proposal.hcTotalPrice || proposal.totalPrice,
   270→      nightlyPrice: proposal.hcNightlyPrice || proposal.nightlyPrice,
   271→      cleaningFee: proposal.hcCleaningFee || proposal.cleaningFee,
   272→      damageDeposit: proposal.hcDamageDeposit || proposal.damageDeposit,
   273→      isCounteroffer: true
   274→    };
   275→  }
   276→
   277→  // Otherwise use original terms
   278→  return {
   279→    daysSelected: proposal.daysSelected,
   280→    reservationWeeks: proposal.reservationWeeks,
   281→    nightsPerWeek: proposal.nightsPerWeek,
   282→    checkInDay: proposal.checkInDay,
   283→    checkOutDay: proposal.checkOutDay,
   284→    totalPrice: proposal.totalPrice,
   285→    nightlyPrice: proposal.nightlyPrice,
   286→    cleaningFee: proposal.cleaningFee,
   287→    damageDeposit: proposal.damageDeposit,
   288→    isCounteroffer: false
   289→  };
   290→}

1→/**
     2→ * Workflow: Load complete proposal details with all enrichments.
     3→ *
     4→ * @intent Orchestrate loading and processing of proposal data from Supabase.
     5→ * @rule Separates infrastructure (fetching) from domain logic (processing).
     6→ * @rule Fetches raw data, then transforms via processors.
     7→ * @rule Returns processed, validated proposal object ready for UI consumption.
     8→ *
     9→ * This workflow replaces the mixed fetcher/transformer pattern from proposalDataFetcher.js
    10→ * by explicitly separating:
    11→ * - Data fetching (infrastructure - still uses Supabase client)
    12→ * - Data processing (domain logic - uses Logic Core processors)
    13→ *
    14→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    15→ * @param {object} params.supabase - Supabase client instance.
    16→ * @param {object} params.rawProposal - Base proposal object (minimal data).
    17→ * @param {object} [params.processListingData] - Listing processor function.
    18→ * @param {object} [params.processUserData] - User processor function.
    19→ * @param {object} [params.processProposalData] - Proposal processor function.
    20→ * @returns {Promise<object>} Fully enriched and processed proposal object.
    21→ *
    22→ * @throws {Error} If rawProposal is missing.
    23→ * @throws {Error} If critical data cannot be loaded.
    24→ *
    25→ * @example
    26→ * import { loadProposalDetailsWorkflow } from '../logic/workflows/booking/loadProposalDetailsWorkflow.js'
    27→ * import { processProposalData } from '../logic/processors/proposal/processProposalData.js'
    28→ * import { processUserData } from '../logic/processors/user/processUserData.js'
    29→ * import { processListingData } from '../logic/processors/listing/processListingData.js'
    30→ * import { supabase } from '../lib/supabase.js'
    31→ *
    32→ * const enrichedProposal = await loadProposalDetailsWorkflow({
    33→ *   supabase,
    34→ *   rawProposal: { _id: 'abc123', Listing: 'xyz', Guest: '456' },
    35→ *   processProposalData,
    36→ *   processUserData,
    37→ *   processListingData
    38→ * })
    39→ */
    40→export async function loadProposalDetailsWorkflow({
    41→  supabase,
    42→  rawProposal,
    43→  processListingData,
    44→  processUserData,
    45→  processProposalData
    46→}) {
    47→  // Validation
    48→  if (!rawProposal) {
    49→    throw new Error('loadProposalDetailsWorkflow: rawProposal is required')
    50→  }
    51→
    52→  if (!supabase) {
    53→    throw new Error('loadProposalDetailsWorkflow: supabase client is required')
    54→  }
    55→
    56→  // Step 1: Fetch listing data
    57→  let processedListing = null
    58→  if (rawProposal.Listing) {
    59→    const { data: listingData, error: listingError } = await supabase
    60→      .from('listing')
    61→      .select('*')
    62→      .eq('_id', rawProposal.Listing)
    63→      .single()
    64→
    65→    if (!listingError && listingData) {
    66→      // Process listing if processor provided
    67→      if (processListingData) {
    68→        try {
    69→          processedListing = processListingData({ rawListing: listingData })
    70→        } catch (err) {
    71→          console.warn('Warning: Failed to process listing data:', err.message)
    72→          // Continue without processed listing - UI will handle gracefully
    73→        }
    74→      } else {
    75→        // No processor provided, use raw data
    76→        processedListing = listingData
    77→      }
    78→    }
    79→  }
    80→
    81→  // Step 2: Fetch guest user data
    82→  let processedGuest = null
    83→  if (rawProposal.Guest) {
    84→    const { data: guestData, error: guestError } = await supabase
    85→      .from('user')
    86→      .select(`
    87→        _id,
    88→        "Name - First",
    89→        "Name - Full",
    90→        "Profile Photo",
    91→        "About Me / Bio",
    92→        "email as text",
    93→        "Phone Number (as text)",
    94→        "Verify - Linked In ID",
    95→        "Verify - Phone",
    96→        "is email confirmed",
    97→        "user verified?"
    98→      `)
    99→      .eq('_id', rawProposal.Guest)
   100→      .single()
   101→
   102→    if (!guestError && guestData) {
   103→      // Process user if processor provided
   104→      if (processUserData) {
   105→        try {
   106→          processedGuest = processUserData(guestData)
   107→        } catch (err) {
   108→          console.warn('Warning: Failed to process guest data:', err.message)
   109→        }
   110→      } else {
   111→        processedGuest = guestData
   112→      }
   113→    }
   114→  }
   115→
   116→  // Step 3: Fetch host user data (from listing creator)
   117→  let processedHost = null
   118→  if (processedListing && processedListing['Created By']) {
   119→    const { data: hostData, error: hostError } = await supabase
   120→      .from('user')
   121→      .select(`
   122→        _id,
   123→        "Name - First",
   124→        "Name - Full",
   125→        "Profile Photo",
   126→        "About Me / Bio",
   127→        "email as text",
   128→        "Phone Number (as text)",
   129→        "Verify - Linked In ID",
   130→        "Verify - Phone",
   131→        "is email confirmed",
   132→        "user verified?"
   133→      `)
   134→      .eq('_id', processedListing['Created By'])
   135→      .single()
   136→
   137→    if (!hostError && hostData) {
   138→      // Process user if processor provided
   139→      if (processUserData) {
   140→        try {
   141→          processedHost = processUserData(hostData)
   142→        } catch (err) {
   143→          console.warn('Warning: Failed to process host data:', err.message)
   144→        }
   145→      } else {
   146→        processedHost = hostData
   147→      }
   148→    }
   149→  }
   150→
   151→  // Step 4: Fetch house rules (if any)
   152→  let houseRules = null
   153→  if (
   154→    rawProposal['House Rules'] &&
   155→    Array.isArray(rawProposal['House Rules']) &&
   156→    rawProposal['House Rules'].length > 0
   157→  ) {
   158→    const { data: rulesData, error: rulesError } = await supabase
   159→      .schema('reference_table')
   160→      .from('zat_features_houserule')
   161→      .select('_id, Name, Icon')
   162→      .in('_id', rawProposal['House Rules'])
   163→
   164→    if (!rulesError && rulesData) {
   165→      houseRules = rulesData
   166→    }
   167→  }
   168→
   169→  // Step 5: Fetch virtual meeting data (if any)
   170→  let virtualMeeting = null
   171→  if (rawProposal['virtual meeting']) {
   172→    const { data: vmData, error: vmError } = await supabase
   173→      .from('virtualmeetingschedulesandlinks')
   174→      .select('*')
   175→      .eq('_id', rawProposal['virtual meeting'])
   176→      .single()
   177→
   178→    if (!vmError && vmData) {
   179→      virtualMeeting = vmData
   180→    }
   181→  }
   182→
   183→  // Step 6: Process proposal with all enriched data
   184→  let processedProposal
   185→  if (processProposalData) {
   186→    try {
   187→      processedProposal = processProposalData({
   188→        rawProposal,
   189→        listing: processedListing,
   190→        guest: processedGuest,
   191→        host: processedHost
   192→      })
   193→    } catch (err) {
   194→      // If processor throws, this is a critical error
   195→      throw new Error(`Failed to process proposal data: ${err.message}`)
   196→    }
   197→  } else {
   198→    // No processor provided, create basic structure
   199→    processedProposal = {
   200→      ...rawProposal,
   201→      _listing: processedListing,
   202→      _guest: processedGuest,
   203→      _host: processedHost
   204→    }
   205→  }
   206→
   207→  // Step 7: Attach additional enrichments
   208→  if (houseRules) {
   209→    processedProposal._houseRules = houseRules
   210→  }
   211→
   212→  if (virtualMeeting) {
   213→    processedProposal._virtualMeeting = virtualMeeting
   214→  }
   215→
   216→  return processedProposal
   217→}

1→/**
     2→ * Data Transformation Utilities for Guest Proposals
     3→ * Transforms Bubble.io data structure to cleaner, more usable format
     4→ *
     5→ * Handles:
     6→ * - Field name normalization (removes spaces, special characters)
     7→ * - Nested object flattening
     8→ * - Type conversions
     9→ * - Default values for missing data
    10→ */
    11→
    12→import { formatPrice } from '../priceCalculations.js';
    13→
    14→// Re-export for backwards compatibility
    15→export { formatPrice };
    16→
    17→/**
    18→ * Transform user data from Bubble.io format
    19→ *
    20→ * @param {Object} rawUser - Raw user object from Supabase
    21→ * @returns {Object} Transformed user object
    22→ */
    23→export function transformUserData(rawUser) {
    24→  if (!rawUser) return null;
    25→
    26→  return {
    27→    id: rawUser._id,
    28→    firstName: rawUser['Name - First'],
    29→    lastName: rawUser['Name - Last'],
    30→    fullName: rawUser['Name - Full'],
    31→    profilePhoto: rawUser['Profile Photo'],
    32→    proposalsList: rawUser['Proposals List']
    33→  };
    34→}
    35→
    36→/**
    37→ * Transform listing data from Bubble.io format
    38→ *
    39→ * @param {Object} rawListing - Raw listing object from Supabase
    40→ * @returns {Object} Transformed listing object
    41→ */
    42→export function transformListingData(rawListing) {
    43→  if (!rawListing) return null;
    44→
    45→  // Extract address from JSONB structure
    46→  const addressData = rawListing['Location - Address'];
    47→  const addressString = typeof addressData === 'object' && addressData?.address
    48→    ? addressData.address

   205→export function getProposalDisplayText(proposal) {

     6→/**
     7→ * Calculate complete pricing breakdown for a listing rental.

     9→ * @intent Provide comprehensive price calculation including all fees.

    16→ * @param {number} params.reservationWeeks - Total reservation span in weeks.
    17→ * @returns {object} Complete pricing breakdown with all calculated values.
    18→ *
    19→ * @throws {Error} If any required parameter is missing or invalid.
    20→ * @throws {Error} If any calculation in the chain fails.
    21→ *
    22→ * @example
    23→ * const breakdown = calculatePricingBreakdown({
    24→ *   listing: { '💰Nightly Host Rate for 4 nights': 100, '💰Cleaning Cost / Maintenance Fee': 50 },
    25→ *   nightsPerWeek: 4,
    26→ *   reservationWeeks: 13

    30→export function calculatePricingBreakdown({ listing, nightsPerWeek, reservationWeeks }) {
    31→  // No Fallback: Validate all inputs
